intro: Suaeda albescens, commonly known as white saltbush, is a halophytic shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in saline and alkaline soils, often found in desert environments and coastal areas. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in harsh conditions. Its small, white flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, hard seeds adapted for dispersal by wind. Suaeda albescens plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
